svg.text:
title: "Week in Ethereum News
June 4, 2022" date: "2022-06-04"
* Ropsten testnet is ready to turn off PoW forever with TTD set Tool to predict TTD
arrival Stakers/nodes must manually override TTD in latest client release Manual
override is useful practice in case of miner hijinx on mainnet Guides on running
Ropsten nodes or specifically a Geth/LH Ropsten node Ropsten beacon chain is live
Reminder: Ropsten to be deprecated post-Merge Merge Community Call discussion
* Stakers/nodes must manually override TTD in latest client release
* Manual override is useful practice in case of miner hijinx on mainnet
* Guides on running Ropsten nodes or specifically a Geth/LH Ropsten node
* Reminder: Ropsten to be deprecated post-Merge
* Latest PoS implementer call . Notes by Ben Edgington Lighthouse/Prysm changing
deposit tracking to be more robust against unlikely edge case of minute block times
* Lighthouse/Prysm changing deposit tracking to be more robust against unlikely edge
* Mainnet shadow fork 6 again merged successfully with some minor issues
* Polynya: understanding the historical storage bottleneck
* Liquid staking derivatives over 25% of stake considered harmful Putting ETH into any
liquid staking when it is over 25% of total stake is putting your ETH at risk Lido
currently at about 30% Justin Drake: design for solo staker liquid staking derivative ,
* Putting ETH into any liquid staking when it is over 25% of total stake is putting
* Justin Drake: design for solo staker liquid staking derivative , but uses SGX
* Understanding Eth PoS as the next generation of consensus protocols
* An explanation of proposer boost and the recent 7 block beacon chain reorg
* ERC5133 : Difficulty bomb delay (Editor’s note: I’m strongly against this at the
* Optimism token launched with its first airdrop Hiccups: JSON-RPC chain reads crashed
but sequencer flawless Simple Docker setup to run your own Optimism node
* Hiccups: JSON-RPC chain reads crashed but sequencer flawless
* Simple Docker setup to run your own Optimism node
* ImmutableX is turning 2% fees on to be sustainable
This newsletter is made possible thanks to Starbloom Ventures !
Starbloom Ventures is a first round venture fund founded by Evan Van Ness to invest in
We pledge 10% of investing profits to support Ethereum public goods.
* thirdweb deploy - no private key deploy flow and auto-Sourcify verifiction as well as
* Delegatable : Solidity library to sign off-chain messages that grant
* MEV Explorer : mev-inspect-js frontend; supports Eth, Polygon, and Arbitrum.
* Implementing zk-lotteries with Circom on top of Tornado Cash’s Nova
* Metamask pays $120k bug bounty for iframe clickjacking vuln
* Rocketpool employee’s computer exploited for 15 ETH
* Skiff offers end-to-end encrypted email using your Eth wallet and ENS
* A tweetstorm version of last week’s Eth roadmap explainer
* Massdrop : a frontend to do a Merkle airdrop
* DeFiSaver live on Arbitrum and Optimism
* Conviction voting using GTC to sort frontend display of Gitcoin grants
* Proof of Integrity - a pilot program in Buenos Aires slums to ensure UBI doesn’t just
go to those who don’t need it
* 1inch integrates Synthetix atomic exchanges for less slippage on big trades
* MobyMask : using web of trust to manage phishing reports
* Rune’s Endgame plan for MakerDAO: a synthetic ETH product and a first metaDAO with
* Ethereum Foundation: generalist developer to drive strategic ecosystem inits
Job listings: $600 for four issues (~75 character limit), payable in ETH/DAI/USDC to
abcoathup.eth on mainnet/Arbitrum/Optimism. Questions? abcoathup at-gmail
* Nate Chastain charged with money laundering and wire fraud in SDNY for OpenSea
* Pooly : buy NFT to support PoolTogether legal defense against the Liz Warren
* Absurd lawsuit to hold all bZx founders and tokenholders liable for security bugs
* ~25 academics/BigTech employees wrote a technically sloppy letter to Congress against
* MS Word in Windows “Follina” unpatched zero-day vuln . Reminder: almost all loss of
crypto comes from Windows users. [ Disclosure: small MSFT shareholder for almost 30
* WSJ reports that Fidelity is hiring to support Eth custody and trading services
* Coinbase rescinding offers that employees had already accepted after promising 2
Follow @WeekinEthNews to find out what the most clicked links are. Follow
@evan_van_ness and @abcoathup to get most of the week’s news in real time.
* Jul 1 – Data Availability Sampling proposals due
Sign up to receive this newsletter weekly
